results.title: Ballad of Lucy Jordan
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the song by Dr. Hook, using mainly photographic stills to tell the sad and ironic tale of a thirty seven year old house wife whose daydreams lead only to despair.

results.title: Ballad of Joe Hill
results.brief_description: Joseph Hillstrom, a young Swedish migrant to America in 1902, found prejudice and corruption instead of the equality and opportunity he was expecting. Disturbed by the injustices suffered by workers, Joe Hillstrom became an organizer of the Industrial Workers of the World, the legendary big union with anarchist reputation.

results.title: Ballad of a young man = Wadjah seorang laki-laki
results.creator_credit: Teguh Karya, Turino Djunaidy and Sarinande Films
results.brief_description: Nineteenth century Dutch Batavia serves as a backdrop to influential Indonesian director Teguh Karya’s first feature. ‘Ballad of a Young Man’ is about Amallo, a local of Portuguese descent, and his troubled relationship with his womanising father. His father is an important man in the village who works for the Dutch, keeping watch over their horses. Amallo, on the other hand, is a rebel who steals ammunition and horses from the Dutch soldiers. When Amallo returns to his village after spending some time in the city, he is betrayed by his best friend who is consumed with jealousy. Meanwhile, Amallo’s father has been promoted by the Dutch for recovering stolen horses. The film is told in flashback, a favourite storytelling technique of the director (see also ‘Bitter Coffee’). Slamet Rahardjo - protege of Teguh Karya - now Head of the Film Council and a prominent figure in Indonesia, makes his acting debut as Amallo. Cast also includes W.D. Mochtar and Rima Melati. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ball on vole
results.brief_description: The apparently aimless flight of a ball which goes out of reach and wanders where it will, is presented in a series of amusing incidents and co-incidences as five boys try to capture it. Drama follows its appearance wherever it goes, people are bumped and shot, and it eludes them to the end. A whimsical film with a unique sense of humour.

results.title: Ball of fire
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper takes centre stage in “Ball of fire” together with Barbara Stanwyck in Howard Hawks’ deliciously funny, and delightful romantic comedy. Cooper is a serious English professor working with his intellectual collegues on a dictionary of American slang. Stanwyck, a red-hot nightclub singer, on the run from the mob, seeks refuge in their house and finds a place in their hearts. Soon, the professor and his friends learn a lot about language and life, and Cooper and Stanwyck prove that the world of semantics is big enough for two who can speak the language of love.

results.title: Balked at the altar
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: An eligible bachelor becomes an unwilling victim of a father’s plan to help his daughter find a husband. Cast includes Mabel Stoughton, Linda Arvidson, George Gebhardt, D.W. Griffith, Robert Harron, Mack Sennett, Arthur V. Johnson, Harry Solter. Silent film with musical soundtrack.

results.title: Balinese surfer 2: wave of change [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Richard Flax, ABC-TV (Australia) and Lucky Country Productions
results.brief_description: In 1978, producer/director Bill Leimbach visited the Indonesian island of Bali and filmed a group of young Balinese boys who had discovered the art of surfing. This is the sequel to that film “Balinese surfer” as Bill and his production team revisit the original group, now all aged in their 40s, 25 years later. We follow their individual stories, the direction life has taken them, and how most of them still take time out to surf. Through personal narratives, intercut with footage from the original film, these Balinese men all express their concern for the environment, particularly with the enormous increase in tourism during the 80s and 90s. Their priority issues are with maintaining the supply of fresh water, and preventing sewage run-off into the ocean, reef bombing, and toxic gases from burning plastic. Bali is renowned for having some of the best waves in the world and through a program of surfing contests (attracting the international media), surfing magazines and an organization called Wave of Change, the focus is now on the next generation, who also surf, to be environmental ambassadors and promote the message for preservation of the marine environment and a policy of sustainable development in Bali and throughout the Indonesian islands. Narration - John Sheerin; Director of Photography - Simon Manzie.

results.title: Balinese surfer
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Tony Dutton and Survival Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the younger generation on the island of Bali have overcome the traditional Balinese fear of the sea to excel in the sport of surfing. Also explains the Balinese attitude to religion and how it is absorbed into every facet of their lives, especially their art and dancing.

results.title: Balinese interlude
results.brief_description: A travelogue on Bali, one of the 7,000 islands that make up the land mass of Indonesia. We visit a fishing village, see examples and areas showing the ingenious terrace cultivation of rice. Many of the entertainments shown are based on Hindu-Balinese religious beliefs which also play a large part in the everyday life of villagers.

results.title: Bali: the release of a soul
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Ted Myers and United Cinema
results.brief_description: To the Balinese, life and religion are one. The film explains this as it explains some aspects of the school system, religion and village life, to the accompaniment of gamelan music.
